artist: Artist: Henri Matisse; Author: Stéphane Mallarmé; Publisher: Albert Skira & Cie, Lausanne; Printer: Léon Pichon , (text); Etcher: Atelier Roger Lacourière, Paris, France
catalogue_raissonne: Boston 196, Ref. no. 196 in "The Artist and the Book"
description: Illustrated unbound book Poésies (Poems) by Stéphane Mallarmé with 29 etchings by Henri Matisse
image_copyright: © Succession H. Matisse %2F Artists Rights Society %28ARS%29%2C New York
text: In 1930 the young publisher, Albert Skira, asked Matisse to illustrate a special collection of poems by the French Symbolist Stéphane Mallarmé (1842–1898). In this, his first commission to illustrate a book, Matisse established both the comprehensive method of design and the “non-imitative” approach to illustration that he subsequently followed in his other important illustrated books.
title: Poésies
